intro: Sebastiania brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking clusters of bright purple berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, while the berries are the main ornamental feature of the plant.
